entries.label: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
Ministry Of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises
Ministry of Fisheries,Animal Husbandry and Dairying
Ministry Of New and Renewable Energy
Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology
Ministry of Women and Child Development
Ministry Of Skill Development And Entrepreneurship
Ministry Of Personnel, Public Grievances And Pensions
Ministry Of Petroleum and Natural Gas
Comptroller And Auditor General Of India
Ministry Of Environment,forests and climate change
Ministry Of Consumer Affairs, Food And Public Distribution
Ministry Of Development Of North Eastern Region
Ministry Of Statistics and Programme Implementation
NITI Aayog (National Institution for Transforming India)

fields.schemeName: Vivah Sahayata Yojana
fields.briefDescription: "Vivah Sahayata Yojana" is a scheme by the Department of Labour, Employment, Training & Skill Development Govt of Jharkhand. The scheme provides financial assistance of ₹ 30,000/- (Rupees Thirty Thousand Only) rupees for the marriage of two children / female members of the family.

fields.schemeName: Biponi Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The objective of the scheme is to support to the Micro & Small enterprises to participate in different trade fairs and events within the State, in the Country and abroad for marketing of their products and also getting the exposure.

fields.schemeName: Mukhya Mantri Mahila Kisan Sashaktikaran Yojana
fields.briefDescription: Mukhya Mantri Mahila Kisan Sashaktikaran Yojana (MMKSY) is a scheme launched by the Government of Gujarat to empower women farmers in the state. The scheme was announced in the 2018-19 budget and is being implemented by the Department of Agriculture and Co-operation.

fields.schemeName: Scholarship To 2 Years Pre-Service Student Teachers Undergoing D.El.Ed Programme At DIETs And CTTC Sohra
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Scholarship to 2 Years Pre-Service Student Teachers undergoing D.El.Ed Programme at DIETs and CTTC Sohra” was launched by the Dept. of Education, Govt. of Meghalaya in 2012. The scheme offers a scholarship of ₹5000 p.m. for 2 years (10 months per year) to attract the state's best talent.

fields.schemeName: Zero Budget Natural Farming
fields.briefDescription: The Rajasthan State government started a scheme "Zero Budget Natual Farming" in 2020-21 to promote  natural farming.

fields.schemeName: Coffee Development Programme in North Eastern Region: Quality Upgradation / Certification: Supply of Baby Pulpers
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Supply of Baby Pulpers" aims to facilitate the improvement of the quality of coffee produced by growers by encouraging them to establish infrastructure for quality enhancement and obtain certification for their coffees, enabling them to earn better returns.

fields.schemeName: Internship Scheme For PG/Research Students In Directorate General Of Trade Remedies (DGTR)
fields.briefDescription: The Internship Scheme by the Directorate General of Trade Remedies (DGTR) provides opportunities for young scholars, especially from Law / Economics stream, interested in learning about trade remedial investigations.

fields.schemeName: Scheme for Margin Money Grant to Nano Units
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Margin Money Grant to Nano Units” is a loan-linked scheme operated by Directorate of Industries & Commerce, Govt. of Kerala. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to Nano units in the State, engaged in manufacturing,job work & service activity having any type of value addition.

fields.schemeName: Dr. B.R. Ambedkar Memorial Award to Scheduled Caste Students
fields.briefDescription: "Dr. B.R. Ambedkar Memorial Award to Scheduled Caste Students” was introduced by the Adi Dravidar Welfare Dept, Govt of Puducherry, is granted to top ranking boy and girl student in each region (Pondicherry, Karaikal and Yanam) who have secured 55% marks in the Higher Secondary Examination.

fields.schemeName: Grant of Financial Assistance to Poor Scheduled Caste Pregnant & Lactating Women
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Grant of Financial Assistance to Poor Scheduled Caste Pregnant & Lactating Women” was introduced by the Adi Dravidar Welfare Department, Government of Puducherry. The objective of the scheme is to provide assistance for the well-being of Pregnant and Lactating mothers and their children.

fields.schemeName: Grant of House Construction Subsidy to Scheduled Caste People
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Grant of House Construction Subsidy to Scheduled Caste People” was introduced by the Adi Dravidar Welfare Dept, Govt of Puducherry. The poor Scheduled Caste people, and other Economically backward class people, who meet the eligibility criteria, are provided house construction subsidy.

fields.schemeName: Distribution of Free House Sites to Scheduled Caste/Other Economically Backward Classes
fields.briefDescription: Through this scheme, the homeless poor Scheduled Caste people, and other Economically backward class people, who meet the eligibility criteria, are provided housing sites to enable them to construct their own houses. Approximately 11,000 persons so far have benefitted from this scheme.

fields.schemeName: Grant of Mahatma Gandhi Memorial Award for Clean Houses
fields.briefDescription: “Grant of Mahatma Gandhi Memorial Award for Clean Houses” was introduced by the Adi Dravidar Welfare Dept, Govt of Puducherry. The objective of the scheme is to motivate the Scheduled Caste people to keep their houses neat and tidy. Incentives are in the form of household articles worth ₹500/-.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance for Marriage of Poor Scheduled Caste Brides
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Financial Assistance for Marriage of Poor Scheduled Caste Brides” was introduced by the Adi Dravidar Welfare Dept, Govt of Puducherry. The objective of the scheme is to provide financial assistance to poor parents from Scheduled Castes for performing the marriage of their daughters.

fields.schemeName: Mukhyamantri Vridhjan Pension Yojna
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Mukhyamantri Vridhjan Pension Yojna” is an old-age pension scheme implemented by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Bihar to provide financial assistance to elderly citizens. Under the scheme, a monthly pension is given to individuals who are aged 60 years or above.

fields.schemeName: Scheme Of Coaching & Allied For Scheduled Castes
fields.briefDescription: Scheme Of Coaching & Allied For Scheduled Castes aims to provide support for the betterment of Scheduled Caste (SC) candidates for coaching and pre examination training in quality coaching institutions to enable them to appear in competitive examinations.

fields.schemeName: Pension to the Persons who lost 100% eye sight
fields.briefDescription: “Pension to the Persons Who Lost 100% Eye Sight" was launched by the Directorate of Social Welfare and Social Education, Government of Tripura. The scheme aims to provide a monthly pension of ₹2,000/- to the differently-abled persons who are 10 years and above in age and have 100% blindness.

fields.schemeName: Mukhyamantri Samajik Sahayata Prakalpa - Vulnerable Women
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Mukhyamantri Samajik Sahayata Prakalpa- Vulnerable Women" was launched by the Directorate of Social Welfare and Social Education, Government of Tripura to provide financial assistance to Vulnerable Woman in need of special care, support or protection because of age, disability.

fields.schemeName: Samagra Samajik Suraksha Vridhavastha Pension Yojana
fields.briefDescription: Initiative of the Department of Social Justice and Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities under the Madhya Pradesh started the scheme "Samagra Samajik Suraksha Vridhavastha Pension Yojana" for the older age people of the state.

fields.schemeName: Nirman Shramik Siksha Kaushal Vikas Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The NIRMAN SHRAMIK SIKSHA KAUSHAL VIKAS YOJANA (NSKKVY) is a scheme launched by the Government of Rajasthan to provide financial assistance for education and skill development to the children of registered construction workers in the state.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance For The Marriage Of Daughters Of Poor Widows And Orphan Girls
fields.briefDescription: This is a welfare scheme by the GNCTD to provide financial assistance to poor widows for performing the marriage of their daughters and to provide financial assistance to the guardians including Homes/Institutions or foster parents of an orphan girl or an orphan girl for her marriage.

fields.schemeName: Indira Gandhi National Vridhavastha Pension Yojana
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, the Madhya Pradesh government provides financial support to the citizens whose families live below the poverty line.

fields.schemeName: Homes For Intellectually Impaired Persons
fields.briefDescription: The "Homes for Intellectually Impaired Persons" is a scheme by the Department of Social Justice & Special Assistance, Govt. of Maharashtra. In this scheme, Mentally Deficient Children who are in need of care and protection are admitted into shelter homes through the Child Welfare Committees.

fields.schemeName: Chief Ministergi Shotharabasingi Tengbang
fields.briefDescription: "Chief Ministergi Shotharabasingi Tengbang" is a Social Welfare Scheme by the Social Welfare Department, Govt. of Manipur. The scheme provides Free Travel & Concession to the Persons with Disabilities. All the PwDs who are a domicile of the State of Manipur are eligible.

fields.schemeName: Chief Minister Floriculture Mission
fields.briefDescription: This is a special scheme initiated during 2014-15 aimed at all-round development of floriculture sector in the State which incorporates cultivation, marketing, training etc. For the year 2015- 16 cultivation of Gerbera under Shade net house with tissue cultured planting materials is proposed.

fields.schemeName: Arunachal Pradesh Entrepreneurship Challenge
fields.briefDescription: APEC will identify, promote, support, and nurture sustainable and locally relevant business ideas and entrepreneurs. The top 10 entrepreneurs selected for the Incubation & Pre-Incubation programmes facilitated by the IIM Calcutta Innovation Park will be awarded up to ₹5,00,000.

fields.schemeName: Saur Sujala Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The Saur Sujala Yojana is to set up solar irrigation pumps for the irrigation needs of the farmers. The scheme has been started on November 01, 2016, with the aim of empowering the farmers by providing irrigation pumps to the farmers at subsidized rates.

fields.schemeName: Stipend Scheme For Scheduled Tribes - Poultry Training Stipend
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Stipend Scheme for Scheduled Tribes - Poultry Training Stipend” was launched by the Department of Agriculture, Farmers Welfare & Co-operation, Government of Gujarat to raise the income of poultry farmers of Schedule Tribes through scientific poultry farming training.

fields.schemeName: Leprosy Pension Scheme
fields.briefDescription: This Leprosy Pension Scheme has been started by the Government of Uttar Pradesh and operated by the Department of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities, Uttar Pradesh.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance To Gad-Hanjis
fields.briefDescription: In the "Financial Assistance to Gad-Hanjis", financial assistance for the purchase of Nylon Twine is provided to the Licensed Fisherman by the Social Welfare Department. The beneficiary shall approach the concerned District Social Welfare Officer (DSWO) for submission of the application.

fields.schemeName: Dr. Ambedkar Medhavi Chattar Sansodhit Yojna
fields.briefDescription: This scheme is being implemented to encourage the merit amongst the students of Scheduled Castes, Backward Classes, Nomadic, DNTs, Semi-Nomadic, Vimukt Jaati and Tapriwas Jaati and to produce a feeling of competition amongst them and motivate them to earn more and more marks from the middle to post.

fields.schemeName: Super IAS 500 Scholarship Manipur
fields.briefDescription: The Super IAS 500 Scholarship is a state government initiative in Manipur to provide coaching and financial support to meritorious and brilliant IAS aspirants in the state, with the aim of making Civil Services training more accessible and affordable.

fields.schemeName: National AIDS Control Organisation (NACO) Internship Programme
fields.briefDescription: NACO initiated the Internship Programme for young students who wish to engage with the Government. The internship programme envisages an opportunity for young students to get familiar with and understand the various dimensions of policy-making & implementation of the National AIDS Control Programme.

fields.schemeName: Abhinandan Education Loan Subsidy Scheme
fields.briefDescription: Chief Minister Sarbananda Sonowal launched the Assam Abhinandan Education Loan Subsidy Scheme at the Srimanta Sankardev International Auditorium on 26 December 2019 in the presence of Finance Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma, , several senior officials of the State Finance Department, and bank officials

fields.schemeName: Quality Improvement Programme (QIP)
fields.briefDescription: The primary objective of this scheme is to enhance the expertise and capabilities of faculty members in degree and diploma-level institutions across the country. The aim is to enable teachers to acquire Master's and Doctoral degrees and instil in them a culture of research.

fields.schemeName: Thayi Bhagya Scheme(comprehensive Maternal Healthcare)
fields.briefDescription: The Thayi Bhagya Scheme, started by Karnataka Government(Health and Family Welfare) for pregnant women, provides free delivery services, medicines, and all other facilities from the point of admission to discharge for pregnant women belonging to BPL families, in registered private hospitals.

fields.schemeName: Death Benefit Scheme (APB&OCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Death Benefit Scheme” was started by the Department of Labour and Employment, Govt. of Arunachal Pradesh for registered workers of the Arunachal Pradesh Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (APB&OCWWB).

fields.schemeName: Scholarship To Scheduled Castes Students Studying In Government ITI’s
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Scholarship to Scheduled Castes Students Studying in Government ITI's” was launched by the Dept. of Welfare of Scheduled Castes & Backward Classes, Government of Haryana in the year 2017-18. This scheme is implemented through Skill Development and Industrial Training Department, Haryana.

fields.schemeName: Schedule Caste Pre-Metric Scholarship Class 06 To 08
fields.briefDescription: In the year 1998, Rajasthan Government started a scholarship to encourage the education of Schedule Cast.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry of Fisheries,Animal Husbandry and Dairying
fields.schemeName: Livestock Health and Diseases Control
fields.briefDescription: The Livestock Health and Diseases Control (LH&DC) scheme is a Centrally Sponsored Scheme (CSS) implemented by the Department of Animal Husbandry and Dairying (DAHD), Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers' Welfare, Government of India.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance To Institutions/Societies Belonging To Scheduled Castes/Backward Classes
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Financial Assistance to Institutions/Societies Belonging to Scheduled Castes/Backward Classes” was launched by the Department of Welfare of Scheduled Castes & Backward Classes, Government of Haryana.

fields.schemeName: Chief Minister's Jeevan Jyoti Swaniyojan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The Chief Minister's Jeevan Jyoti Swaniyojan Yojana is a self-employment scheme initiated by the Government of Assam. The primary objective of the scheme is to provide avenues of self-employment to educated unemployed youth in Assam.

fields.schemeName: Ramalingaswami Re-Entry Fellowship
fields.briefDescription: The Department of Biotechnology has instituted a scheme known as the “Ramalingaswami Re-Entry Fellowship”. The scheme is aimed at Indian Nationals who are working overseas in various fields of biotechnology and life sciences and are interested in taking up scientific research positions in India.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance For Development Of Buddhist/Tibetan Arts And Culture
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Financial Assistance for Development of Buddhist/Tibetan Arts and Culture” was launched by the Ministry of Culture, Government of India to provide financial assistance to voluntary Buddhist/Tibetan organizations including Monasteries.

fields.schemeName: Krushi Mahotsav
fields.briefDescription: The Krishi Mahotsav Yojana is an agricultural development scheme launched by the Government of Gujarat in the year 2010. The scheme aims to boost agricultural productivity and increase the income of farmers in the state.

fields.schemeName: Futkar Sabji, Phal-Phool Vikreta Hetu Taraju, Baat Evan Tokari Sahaayata Yojana
fields.briefDescription: Chhattisgarh State Government started a scheme "Futkar Sabji, Phal-Phool Vikreta Hetu Taraju, Baat Evan Tokari Sahaayata Yojana" for unorganized worker on 15 June 2016.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance To Visually Impaired Advocates
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Financial Assistance to visually impaired Advocates” was launched by the Department of Social Justice, Government of Kerala.

fields.schemeName: Skill Development Fee Reimbursement Scheme
fields.briefDescription: Through the “Skill Development Fee Reimbursement Scheme”, the SPC will reimburse 50% of the fees up to ₹ 50,000/- to the students who have successfully completed an SPC-approved technical skill training program in any of the approved domains from a Goan educational institute.

fields.schemeName: Incentive To Saharia Students For B.Ed
fields.briefDescription: In Rajasthan, "Incentive To Saharia Students For B.Ed" scheme is run by the "Tribal Area Development Department" from 2004-05.

fields.schemeName: Coaching Assistance Scheme For Scheduled Caste Students For Pre-Exam Preparation Like NEET, JEE, GUJCET
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Coaching Assistance Scheme for Scheduled Caste Students for Pre-Exam Preparation like NEET, JEE, GUJCET” was launched by the Govt. of Gujarat during the year 2014-15 to provide coaching assistance to students of Scheduled Caste category who are preparing for exams like NEET, JEE, GUJCET.

fields.schemeName: Aswasakiranam
fields.briefDescription: Aswasakiranam Scheme envisages assisting the caregivers of physically and mentally disabled bedridden patients, who are their family members or relatives. All those who have been providing caregiving service to patients since 02/08/10 will be paid monthly assistance with retrospective effect.

fields.schemeName: Nirmaan Shramik Mrtyu Evan Divyaang Sahaayata Yojana
fields.briefDescription: Chhattisgarh State Government started "Nirmaan Shramik Mrtyu Evan Divyaang Sahaayata Yojana" for Building and other construction workers.

fields.schemeName: Scheme for Promoting Young Talents in Science-II
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Scheme for Promoting Young Talents in Science-II (SPYTiS-II)” is constituted for the purpose of providing financial and technical assistance to talented young students who have innovative ideas in scientific/technological pursuits.

fields.schemeName: Institutional Support for Development and Marketing of Tribal Products/Produce
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Institutional Support for development and Marketing of Tribal Products/Produce” was introduced in 2014-15 by the Ministry of Tribal Affairs, Government of India.

fields.schemeName: Innovation In Science Pursuit For Inspired Research (INSPIRE) - Internship
fields.briefDescription: INSPIRE INTERNSHIP aims to provide exposure to the top 1% of students at the Class X Board level by organizing Science Camps either during summer or winter which provides an opportunity for them to interact with Science icons from India and abroad, including Nobel Laureates.

fields.schemeName: Skill Development Promotion Scheme
fields.briefDescription: Through the “Skill Development Promotion Scheme”, the retail educational institutes that impart programming and technical skills are encouraged to establish learning centres in Goa. Institutes listed by the startup promotion cell and providing courses at pre-fixed rates will be provided subsidies.

fields.schemeName: Mukhyamantri Aawasiye Bhu-Adhikaar Yojana
fields.briefDescription: Revenue Department of Madhya Pradesh State started this scheme to provide residential plots.

fields.schemeName: Hiv / Aids Pension Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The Government of Puducherry introduced the HIV / AIDS Pension Scheme to extend a helping hand through monthly financial assistance to HIV/AIDS Affected People so that they could defray some petty personal/ medical expenses without depending on others.

fields.schemeName: Abhayakiranam Scheme-Financial Assistance To Destitute Widows
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Abhayakiranam Scheme-Financial Assistance to Destitute Widows” was launched by the Department of Social Justice, Government of Kerala to provide a safe and better living environment to destitute and homeless widows.

fields.schemeName: Award Of Stipend To VJNT And SBC Students Studying In ITI
fields.briefDescription: The Government of Maharashtra launched a scheme that provides to encourage Vimukta Jati and Nomadic Tribes (V.J.N.T.) & Special Backward Class (S.B.C.) students and promote the interest in Technical education.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
fields.schemeName: National Action Plan for Skill Development of Persons with Disabilities
fields.briefDescription: A dedicated skill development program aimed at providing high-quality vocational training with a focus on PwDs. The objective is to enhance the skills of PwDs by providing quality vocational skill training, enabling them to gain meaningful employment and become contributing members of society.

fields.schemeName: Sastraposhini Scheme
fields.briefDescription: Sastraposhini is a programme envisaged by Kerala State Council for Science, Technology and Environment (KSCSTE) for strengthening science education in schools of Kerala.

fields.schemeName: Gatidhara Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Gatidhara Scheme” was launched by the Transport Department, Government of West Bengal in August 2014 for employment of registered unemployed youth of the State in the transport sector.

fields.schemeName: Goa (Technical/ Vocational Training To Sex Workers And Sexually Abused Women) Scheme, 2013 (PRABHAT)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides technical/vocational training for sex workers and sexually abused women to enable them to earn for their livelihood through such technical/vocational training and skill. The department will take the assistance of members of reputed NGOs/Trust/Society/professionals/expert bodies.

fields.schemeName: Mukhyamantri Noni Sashaktikaran Sahayata Yojana
fields.briefDescription: Chhattisgarh State Government started "Mukhyamantri Noni Sashaktikaran Sahayata Yojana" for the girl child of the family.

fields.schemeName: Swasraya Scheme For Parents/Mothers Of Physically Handicapped/Mentally Retarded Persons
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Swasraya Scheme for Parents/Mothers of Physically Handicapped/Mentally Retarded Persons” was launched by the Department of Social Justice, Government of Kerala.

fields.schemeName: Scheme for Upliftment of Utsavi Rangabhumi of Goa
fields.briefDescription: The “Scheme for Upliftment of Utsavi Rangabhumi of Goa” has been designed with the objective of encouraging the festival theatre of Goa which is known as “Gomantakiya Utsavi Rangabhumi”. This form of theatre has an illustrious tradition of presenting plays during festivals in the villages.

fields.schemeName: Swahid Kushal Konwar Sarbajanin Briddha Pension Achoni
fields.briefDescription: Launched on 2nd October 2018, "Swahid Kushal Konwar Sarbajanin Briddha Pension Achoni" is a Pension Scheme by the Govt. of Assam. The objective of the scheme is to streamline the payment of old-age pensions and funds. The beneficiary will get a sum of ₹250/- per month.

fields.schemeName: Junior Merit (Class - 11 To 12)
fields.briefDescription: The Department of School & Mass Education, Government of Odisha is awarding "Junior Merit Scholarship" under the Scheme 'e-medhabruti’ to provide financial assistance to the meritorious Higher Secondary School students of Odisha from families whose parental income does not exceed 6.00 lakhs.

fields.schemeName: Mizoram Research Fellowship
fields.briefDescription: The "Mizoram Research Fellowship" aims to provide financial assistance to research workers and teachers, preferably below the age of 45 years, who have established their reputation for research OR have obtained a doctorate degree OR have published research work to their credit.

fields.schemeName: Jagananna Amma Vodi
fields.briefDescription: "Jagananna Amma Vodi" provides poor mothers (or recognized guardians in the absence of mothers) ₹15,000/- per annum for sending their children to school. The objective of the scheme is to enhance access to schools, ensure equity, assuring quality education, and achieve better learning outcomes.

fields.schemeName: Akanksha Scheme
fields.briefDescription: According to the plan of the Government of Madhya Pradesh, Tribal Affairs Department, the target is to provide coaching to the scheduled tribe students of the state for the preparation of national entrance examination (JEE, NEET / AIIMS, CLET) from reputed coaching institutes in division headquarter

fields.schemeName: Stipend To Students Studying At Govt. Hindi Institute Dimapur
fields.briefDescription: The Department has given Stipend to the students studying at Govt. Hindi Institute Dimapur every year from the allocated fund under Scholarship by the State Govt. This scholarship is availed by the students studying in this institute, from the year 2015-16.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
fields.schemeName: Persons With Disabilities Scheme In Colleges: Financial Assistance To Visually Challenged Teachers
fields.briefDescription: The Scheme has been formulated to help visually challenged permanent teachers to pursue teaching and research with the help of a Reader and by using teaching and learning aids by way of providing Reader’s Allowance and funds for the purchase of Braille books, recorded materials etc.

fields.schemeName: Development Of Playfield Under CMSGUY
fields.briefDescription: "Development of Playfield" is an Infrastructure Development Scheme by the Assam Youth Development Mission Society (AYDMS) formed under CMSGUY Scheme. It has been decided to develop 500 Football Playfields during 2017-18 in the first phase of operation of the scheme.

fields.schemeName: Farmer Suicide Ex-Gratia
fields.briefDescription: "Farmer Suicide Ex-Gratia" is a Financial Assistance Scheme by the Agriculture & Cooperation Dept. of the Govt. of Andhra Pradesh. The scheme provides financial assistance of ₹ 7,00,000 to the family members of the deceased farmers/tenant farmers, who commit suicide due to agrarian reasons.

fields.schemeName: Double Bedroom Housing Scheme (2BHK Scheme)
fields.briefDescription: The Govt. of Telangana formulated the 2BHK Scheme in Oct'2015 to provide 100% subsidized housing to the poor. The "Double Bedroom Housing" provides two bedrooms, a hall, a kitchen, and two toilets covering the 560 Sqft plinth area. The plot area is 125 sq yd for an independent house in a rural area.

fields.schemeName: Chief Minister's State Disability Pension Scheme - Sikkim
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Chief Minister's State Disability Pension Scheme (CMDPS)” was started by the Women & Child Welfare Department, Govt. of Sikkim to provide financial assistance to the differently abled person who has a disability of 40% and above.

fields.schemeName: Rajasthan Chief Minister's Relief Fund - Accident Assistance
fields.briefDescription: "Rajasthan Chief Minister's Relief Fund - Accident Assistance" is a scheme by the Chief Minister's Secretariat, Govt. of Rajasthan. In case of death due to accident, ₹ 1,00,000 is provided. In case of serious injury, assistance is up to ₹ 20,000. The assistance is "one-time full-support".

fields.schemeName: YSR Law Nestham
fields.briefDescription: Being implemented since December 2019, the scheme "YSR Law Nestham" by the Law Department, Govt. of Andhra Pradesh provides a monthly stipend of an amount of ₹ 5,000/- to the Junior Advocates. Only the Law Graduates, who passed out in the year 2016 and afterward are only eligible.

fields.schemeName: Stipends To Trainees In Industrial Training Institute
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Stipends to Trainees in Industrial Training Institute” was launched by the Department of Social Justice and Special Assistance, Government of Maharashtra for Scheduled Caste students in Industrial Training Institute.

fields.schemeName: Pension Yojana (JBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: "Pension Yojana (JBOCWWB)" is a scheme by the Department of Labour, Employment, Training & Skill Development Govt of Jharkhand. The scheme provides pension of ₹ 1,000/- per month to those who have contributed to the JBOCWWB for at least 30 years.

fields.schemeName: Rupashree Prakalpa
fields.briefDescription: The Rupashree Prakalpa Scheme is a social welfare scheme launched by the Government of West Bengal, India, in 2018. The scheme aims to provide one-time financial assistance to the economically disadvantaged families of the state for the marriage of their daughters.

fields.schemeName: Border Areas Scholarship
fields.briefDescription: The Border Areas Development Department has launched the Border Area Scholarship Meghalaya so that the students residing in the Border areas specified by the Border Area Development Programme will be able to get scholarship amounts for undertaking a higher course of studies.

fields.schemeName: Film Finance Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The Film Finance Scheme of Assam is an initiative by the Assam government to support the development and growth of the film industry in the state. This scheme aims to provide financial assistance to filmmakers and production houses to encourage the production of quality films in Assam.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance for Setting up Crab Culture Unit
fields.briefDescription: Through this scheme, financial assistance of 25% of the actual cost, limited to ₹1,50,000 per hectare is provided to eligible fishermen for setting up crab culture unit. Only Fish Farmer/ Individual/ Registered Self Help Group/ Societies, interested in the setting up of the Crab Farming Unit.

fields.schemeName: Incentive to Widow's Remarriage
fields.briefDescription: The objective of this scheme is to encourage and support widows to remarry and lead a normal life in society. Through this scheme, eligible individuals receive financial assistance of ₹50,000/- in the form of a National Saving Certificate. The bridegroom should be a bachelor or a widower.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
fields.schemeName: Kisan Credit Card
fields.briefDescription: The Kisan Credit Card (KCC) scheme was introduced in 1998 for issue of Kisan Credit Cards to farmers on the basis of their holdings for uniform adoption by the banks so that farmers may use them to readily purchase agriculture inputs and draw cash for their production needs.

fields.schemeName: Integrated Sheep Development Scheme
fields.briefDescription: ISDS was launched in the year 2020-21 by the J&K Govt. to promote income generation through the establishment of sheep & goat units. This scheme is innovative & self-sustaining as fresh units shall be established in a continuous cyclic manner from the retrieved livestock of previous beneficiaries.

fields.schemeName: Educational Assistance To Children Of Prisoners
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Educational Assistance to Children of Prisoners” was launched by the Department of Social Justice, Government of Kerala.

fields.schemeName: Dayanand Bandodkar Scheme For Higher Education For Orphans
fields.briefDescription: "Dayanand Bandodkar Scheme for Higher Education for Orphans" supports the educational needs of orphan children who are deprived of higher education for want of financial resources. The Scheme envisages taking care of such children from their Undergraduate Course to the Post Graduate Course.

fields.schemeName: AICTE - Research Promotion Scheme (RPS)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "AICTE - Research Promotion Scheme (RPS)" was introduced by the All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE), Department of Higher Education (DoHE) in order to promote research in identified thrust areas of technical education. The maximum limit of funding is ₹ 25,00,000.

fields.schemeName: Safai Karmakar Prasuti Sahayata Yojana
fields.briefDescription: Chhattisgarh State Government started a scheme "Safai Karmakar Prasuti Sahayata Yojana" for unorganized worker on 11 March 2015.

fields.schemeName: Delhi Arogya Nidhi
fields.briefDescription: Delhi Arogya Nidhi (DAN) is a scheme to provide financial assistance upto ₹1.5 lacs to needy patients who have National Food Security Cards for the treatment of diseases in Government hospitals only.

fields.schemeName: Swarnajayanti Fellowships Scheme
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, a selected number of young scientists, with proven track record, are provided special assistance and support to enable them to pursue basic research in frontier areas of science and technology.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises
fields.schemeName: Incubation Scheme
fields.briefDescription: Incubation Scheme aims to promote and support untapped creativity and to promote adoption of latest technologies in MSMEs that seek the validation of their ideas at the proof-of-concept level.

fields.schemeName: ARAVANAIPPU
fields.briefDescription: "ARAVANAIPPU", a scheme by the Dept of Women and Child Development, Govt of Puducherry aims to improve the status of the girl child and provide nutritious food; financial assistance of ₹1200 is offered to lactating mothers. The girl child of the applicant should be born after 1-4-2005.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
fields.schemeName: National Bamboo Mission
fields.briefDescription: Restructured National Bamboo Mission was launched during 2018-19 as a Centrally Sponsored Scheme (CSS) after the historical amendment of the Indian Forest Act during 2017 to exclude bamboo out from definition of tree.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises
fields.schemeName: Reimbursement of membership Fee in Government promoted E-Commerce Portals
fields.briefDescription: Reimbursement of Membership fee of Government promoted e-commerce portals Scheme is a sub scheme under National Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe Hub (NSSH) scheme.

fields.schemeName: Pradhan Mantri Gram Sadak Yojana
fields.briefDescription: With the objective of providing rural connectivity, the Government of India launched the Pradhan Mantri Gram Sadak Yojana (referred to as PMGSY-I hereinafter) on 25th December 2000 to provide all-weather access to eligible unconnected habitations.
